Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 10 involves preparing the pie dish with pastry, which requires the chicken mixture from Step 4 to be ready for assembly.

title: spiced butternut squash soup
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 190 C / Gas mark 6.', 'Pour a small layer of water in a baking dish, or a swiss roll tin.', 'Place the squash halves cut side down on the dish.', 'Bake for about 40 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the flesh.', 'Cool slightly, then remove the peel.', 'Set aside.', 'Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.', 'Add the onion, leek and garlic, and saute for a few minutes, until tender.', 'Pour the chicken stock into the pot.', 'Add the potatoes, and bring to the boil.', 'Cook for about 20 minutes, or until soft.', 'Add the squash, and mash with the potatoes until chunks are small.', 'Use an immersion hand blender to puree the soup, or transfer to a blender or food processor in batches, and puree until smooth.', 'Return to the pot.', 'Season the soup with cayenne pepper, allspice, nutmeg, ginger, salt and pepper, then stir in the sherry, cream and milk.', 'Heat through, but do not boil.', 'Ladle into bowls, and top with a dollop of soured cream if desired.']
why_question: Why must Step 11 happen after Step 6?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: spiced butternut squash soup

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 190 C / Gas mark 6.
2. Pour a small layer of water in a baking dish, or a swiss roll tin.
3. Place the squash halves cut side down on the dish.
4. Bake for about 40 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the flesh.
5. Cool slightly, then remove the peel.
6. Set aside.
7. Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.
8. Add the onion, leek and garlic, and saute for a few minutes, until tender.
9. Pour the chicken stock into the pot.
10. Add the potatoes, and bring to the boil.
11. Cook for about 20 minutes, or until soft.
12. Add the squash, and mash with the potatoes until chunks are small.
13. Use an immersion hand blender to puree the soup, or transfer to a blender or food processor in batches, and puree until smooth.
14. Return to the pot.
15. Season the soup with cayenne pepper, allspice, nutmeg, ginger, salt and pepper, then stir in the sherry, cream and milk.
16. Heat through, but do not boil.
17. Ladle into bowls, and top with a dollop of soured cream if desired.


1. Must Step 11 happen after Step 6?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 11 involves cooking the potatoes, which must be added to the pot after the squash has been baked and prepared in steps 1-6.

title: fusilli-and-meatballs
steps: ['Coat a large saucepan with cooking spray or a teaspoon of olive oil and set over a medium-high heat.', 'Sauté the onion and garlic for about 5 minutes or until soft.', 'Transfer 2 tablespoons of the onion mixture to a large bowl.', 'Set aside.', 'Whiz the tomatoes, with their juice, in a food processor until fairly smooth.', 'Add to the saucepan.', 'Bring to the boil over medium-high heat.', 'Reduce the heat to medium-low.', 'Cover and simmer, stirring often, for 30 minutes.', 'Add the basil and oregano halfway through this time.', 'Process the bread until crumbs form.', 'Add the crumbs, beef, egg, milk and pepper to the onion mixture in the bowl and mix just until blended.', 'Shape into 20 meatballs about 2.5cm (1in) diameter.', 'Coat a frying pan with cooking spray or olive oil and set over medium-high heat.', 'Cook the meatballs, in batches, for about 8 minutes or until browned on all sides.', 'Drain on kitchen paper.', 'Add the meatballs to the tomato sauce.', 'Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, cook the pasta according to the instructions on the packet.', 'Drain and toss with 3 ladlefuls of the sauce in a large heated serving bowl.', 'Spoon the meatballs and remaining sauce over the top, then serve.']
why_question: Why must Step 7 happen after Step 1?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: fusilli-and-meatballs

Procedure:
1. Coat a large saucepan with cooking spray or a teaspoon of olive oil and set over a medium-high heat.
2. Sauté the onion and garlic for about 5 minutes or until soft.
3. Transfer 2 tablespoons of the onion mixture to a large bowl.
4. Set aside.
5. Whiz the tomatoes, with their juice, in a food processor until fairly smooth.
6. Add to the saucepan.
7. Bring to the boil over medium-high heat.
8. Reduce the heat to medium-low.
9. Cover and simmer, stirring often, for 30 minutes.
10. Add the basil and oregano halfway through this time.
11. Process the bread until crumbs form.
12. Add the crumbs, beef, egg, milk and pepper to the onion mixture in the bowl and mix just until blended.
13. Shape into 20 meatballs about 2.5cm (1in) diameter.
14. Coat a frying pan with cooking spray or olive oil and set over medium-high heat.
15. Cook the meatballs, in batches, for about 8 minutes or until browned on all sides.
16. Drain on kitchen paper.
17. Add the meatballs to the tomato sauce.
18. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes.
19. Meanwhile, cook the pasta according to the instructions on the packet.
20. Drain and toss with 3 ladlefuls of the sauce in a large heated serving bowl.
21. Spoon the meatballs and remaining sauce over the top, then serve.

title: chocolate-chocolate-cake
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C / Gas Mark 4.', 'Place the chocolate chips, coffee and water in a microwave safe bowl.', 'Microwave until chocolate is almost melted.', 'Remove and whisk until mixture is smooth.', 'Set aside to cool.', 'Using a hand held mixer, beat butter and margarine together in a large bowl until creamy.', 'Gradually beat in sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each one.', 'Slowly add the flour and beat at a low speed.', 'Add the cooled chocolate to the mix and beat again.', 'In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.', 'Then increase speed and beat until stiff.', 'Fold egg white mixture, one third at a time, into the chocolate mixture until blended thoroughly.', 'Grease a 23cm springform tin or a cake tin with deep sides.', 'Wrap the bottom of the tin securely with greaseproof paper or foil, so it comes up about 1 .5cm on the sides.', 'Pour the mixture into the cake tin.', 'Bake for I hour.', 'The cake is ready when a skewer inserted about 1 .5cm from the side of the tin comes out clean.', 'Note that the cake is very dense, so the top may crack when baking.', 'Cool in the tin for 10 minutes to allow the cake to set.', 'Then remove from the tin, and allow to cool completely, which may take several hours.', 'Sift icing sugar lightly over the top for decoration.']
why_question: Why must Step 11 happen after Step 7?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: chocolate-chocolate-cake

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C / Gas Mark 4.
2. Place the chocolate chips, coffee and water in a microwave safe bowl.
3. Microwave until chocolate is almost melted.
4. Remove and whisk until mixture is smooth.
5. Set aside to cool.
6. Using a hand held mixer, beat butter and margarine together in a large bowl until creamy.
7. Gradually beat in sugar until light and fluffy.
8. Gradually beat in egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each one.
9. Slowly add the flour and beat at a low speed.
10. Add the cooled chocolate to the mix and beat again.
11. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.
12. Then increase speed and beat until stiff.
13. Fold egg white mixture, one third at a time, into the chocolate mixture until blended thoroughly.
14. Grease a 23cm springform tin or a cake tin with deep sides.
15. Wrap the bottom of the tin securely with greaseproof paper or foil, so it comes up about 1 .5cm on the sides.
16. Pour the mixture into the cake tin.
17. Bake for I hour.
18. The cake is ready when a skewer inserted about 1 .5cm from the side of the tin comes out clean.
19. Note that the cake is very dense, so the top may crack when baking.
20. Cool in the tin for 10 minutes to allow the cake to set.
21. Then remove from the tin, and allow to cool completely, which may take several hours.
22. Sift icing sugar lightly over the top for decoration.


1. Must Step 11 happen after Step 7?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 11 involves beating egg whites until foamy and then stiff, which must be folded into the main batter prepared in steps 6-10, thus it logically follows after the batter preparation in step 7.

title: very-vanilla-ry-cheesecake
steps: ['Preheat oven to 150 C / Gas 2 and lightly butter a 26cm springform tin.', 'Place the biscuits into a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin.', 'Pour the crumbs into a bowl and mix with the scraped seeds of 1 vanilla bean.', 'Drizzle the crumbs with melted butter and stir to combine.', 'Press the crumb mixture firmly into the bottom and up the sides of the springform tin and set aside.', 'Place the softened cream cheese and sugar into the work bowl of an electric mixer and beat for about 3 minutes on Medium speed, until the mixture is smooth.', 'Beat in the eggs one at a time, incorporating each egg before adding the next one.', 'Add the scraped seeds of 2 vanilla beans, vanilla extract, soured cream and double cream and beat on Medium-High speed for about 1 minute, until the mixture is blended and smooth.', 'Pour the mixture into the biscuit base, leaving about 5cm of space from the top of the tin for the cake to expand as it bakes.', 'Place a baking dish onto the bottom rack of the preheated oven and fill it halfway with boiling water.', 'Place the cheesecake onto the middle rack, above the tin of boiling water and bake until a small knife inserted into the middle of the cheesecake comes out clean, about 1 hour and 20 minutes.', 'Turn the oven off and let the cheesecake cool down inside the oven for 1 hour.', 'Cover the cheesecake with cling film, then foil and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.']
why_question: Why must Step 8 happen after Step 4?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: very-vanilla-ry-cheesecake

Procedure:
1. Preheat oven to 150 C / Gas 2 and lightly butter a 26cm springform tin.
2. Place the biscuits into a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin.
3. Pour the crumbs into a bowl and mix with the scraped seeds of 1 vanilla bean.
4. Drizzle the crumbs with melted butter and stir to combine.
5. Press the crumb mixture firmly into the bottom and up the sides of the springform tin and set aside.
6. Place the softened cream cheese and sugar into the work bowl of an electric mixer and beat for about 3 minutes on Medium speed, until the mixture is smooth.
7. Beat in the eggs one at a time, incorporating each egg before adding the next one.
8. Add the scraped seeds of 2 vanilla beans, vanilla extract, soured cream and double cream and beat on Medium-High speed for about 1 minute, until the mixture is blended and smooth.
9. Pour the mixture into the biscuit base, leaving about 5cm of space from the top of the tin for the cake to expand as it bakes.
10. Place a baking dish onto the bottom rack of the preheated oven and fill it halfway with boiling water.
11. Place the cheesecake onto the middle rack, above the tin of boiling water and bake until a small knife inserted into the middle of the cheesecake comes out clean, about 1 hour and 20 minutes.
12. Turn the oven off and let the cheesecake cool down inside the oven for 1 hour.
13. Cover the cheesecake with cling film, then foil and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.

title: tortellini-fritto-with-almond-butter
steps: ['Bring a saucepan of water to the boil.', 'Add the tortellini and cook according to the instructions on the packet, however I recommend you slightly under cook it and drain.', 'In a non-stick shallow pan, heat some olive oil and gently fry the tortellini.', "If you slightly undercooked your tortellini then it's less likely to stick to the pan.", 'Add some honey, salt to taste and around 2 tablespoons of the almond butter to the pan.', 'Continue to gently fry and stir the tortellini until golden brown.', 'Serve the tortellini with a drizzle of olive oil, freshly grated Parmesan cheese and green leaf salad of your choice.', 'Enjoy!']

Goal: tortellini-fritto-with-almond-butter

Procedure:
1. Bring a saucepan of water to the boil.
2. Add the tortellini and cook according to the instructions on the packet, however I recommend you slightly under cook it and drain.
3. In a non-stick shallow pan, heat some olive oil and gently fry the tortellini.
4. If you slightly undercooked your tortellini then it's less likely to stick to the pan.
5. Add some honey, salt to taste and around 2 tablespoons of the almond butter to the pan.
6. Continue to gently fry and stir the tortellini until golden brown.
7. Serve the tortellini with a drizzle of olive oil, freshly grated Parmesan cheese and green leaf salad of your choice.
8. Enjoy!

steps: ['Preheat oven to 150 C / Gas 2 and lightly butter a 26cm springform tin.', 'Place the biscuits into a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin.', 'Pour the crumbs into a bowl and mix with the scraped seeds of 1 vanilla bean.', 'Drizzle the crumbs with melted butter and stir to combine.', 'Press the crumb mixture firmly into the bottom and up the sides of the springform tin and set aside.', 'Place the softened cream cheese and sugar into the work bowl of an electric mixer and beat for about 3 minutes on Medium speed, until the mixture is smooth.', 'Beat in the eggs one at a time, incorporating each egg before adding the next one.', 'Add the scraped seeds of 2 vanilla beans, vanilla extract, soured cream and double cream and beat on Medium-High speed for about 1 minute, until the mixture is blended and smooth.', 'Pour the mixture into the biscuit base, leaving about 5cm of space from the top of the tin for the cake to expand as it bakes.', 'Place a baking dish onto the bottom rack of the preheated oven and fill it halfway with boiling water.', 'Place the cheesecake onto the middle rack, above the tin of boiling water and bake until a small knife inserted into the middle of the cheesecake comes out clean, about 1 hour and 20 minutes.', 'Turn the oven off and let the cheesecake cool down inside the oven for 1 hour.', 'Cover the cheesecake with cling film, then foil and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.']
why_question: Why must Step 10 happen after Step 9?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: very-vanilla-ry-cheesecake

Procedure:
1. Preheat oven to 150 C / Gas 2 and lightly butter a 26cm springform tin.
2. Place the biscuits into a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin.
3. Pour the crumbs into a bowl and mix with the scraped seeds of 1 vanilla bean.
4. Drizzle the crumbs with melted butter and stir to combine.
5. Press the crumb mixture firmly into the bottom and up the sides of the springform tin and set aside.
6. Place the softened cream cheese and sugar into the work bowl of an electric mixer and beat for about 3 minutes on Medium speed, until the mixture is smooth.
7. Beat in the eggs one at a time, incorporating each egg before adding the next one.
8. Add the scraped seeds of 2 vanilla beans, vanilla extract, soured cream and double cream and beat on Medium-High speed for about 1 minute, until the mixture is blended and smooth.
9. Pour the mixture into the biscuit base, leaving about 5cm of space from the top of the tin for the cake to expand as it bakes.
10. Place a baking dish onto the bottom rack of the preheated oven and fill it halfway with boiling water.
11. Place the cheesecake onto the middle rack, above the tin of boiling water and bake until a small knife inserted into the middle of the cheesecake comes out clean, about 1 hour and 20 minutes.
12. Turn the oven off and let the cheesecake cool down inside the oven for 1 hour.
13. Cover the cheesecake with cling film, then foil and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.


1. Must Step 10 happen after Step 9?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 10 involves placing a baking dish with boiling water in the oven to create a steamy environment, which must be done before the cheesecake is baked in Step 11.

title: spiced butternut squash soup
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 190 C / Gas mark 6.', 'Pour a small layer of water in a baking dish, or a swiss roll tin.', 'Place the squash halves cut side down on the dish.', 'Bake for about 40 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the flesh.', 'Cool slightly, then remove the peel.', 'Set aside.', 'Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.', 'Add the onion, leek and garlic, and saute for a few minutes, until tender.', 'Pour the chicken stock into the pot.', 'Add the potatoes, and bring to the boil.', 'Cook for about 20 minutes, or until soft.', 'Add the squash, and mash with the potatoes until chunks are small.', 'Use an immersion hand blender to puree the soup, or transfer to a blender or food processor in batches, and puree until smooth.', 'Return to the pot.', 'Season the soup with cayenne pepper, allspice, nutmeg, ginger, salt and pepper, then stir in the sherry, cream and milk.', 'Heat through, but do not boil.', 'Ladle into bowls, and top with a dollop of soured cream if desired.']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: spiced butternut squash soup

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 190 C / Gas mark 6.
2. Pour a small layer of water in a baking dish, or a swiss roll tin.
3. Place the squash halves cut side down on the dish.
4. Bake for about 40 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the flesh.
5. Cool slightly, then remove the peel.
6. Set aside.
7. Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.
8. Add the onion, leek and garlic, and saute for a few minutes, until tender.
9. Pour the chicken stock into the pot.
10. Add the potatoes, and bring to the boil.
11. Cook for about 20 minutes, or until soft.
12. Add the squash, and mash with the potatoes until chunks are small.
13. Use an immersion hand blender to puree the soup, or transfer to a blender or food processor in batches, and puree until smooth.
14. Return to the pot.
15. Season the soup with cayenne pepper, allspice, nutmeg, ginger, salt and pepper, then stir in the sherry, cream and milk.
16. Heat through, but do not boil.
17. Ladle into bowls, and top with a dollop of soured cream if desired.


1. Must Step 9 happen after Step 6?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 9 involves adding chicken stock to the pot where onions, leeks, and garlic have been sautéed, which follows the setting aside of the baked squash in Step 6.

title: strawberry-tiramisu-trifle
steps: ['Set 3 strawberries for the garnish aside, and cut the rest into slices.', 'In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese with a hand whisk until creamy, gradually adding 2 tablespoons of the coffee.', 'Then stir in the custard and finally fold in the whipped cream.', 'Brush the sponge fingers with the remaining coffee.', 'Line a glass bowl with one layer of the soaked sponge fingers.', 'Spread half of the strawberries over the sponge fingers.', 'Sprinkle half of the grated chocolate over that and then half of the custard mixture.', 'Repeat the layers in order again.', 'Cut the remaining 3 strawberries in half and lay them on top of the trifle.', 'Cover and leave in the fridge for at least 4 hours, best overnight.']
why_question: Why must Step 6 happen after Step 3?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: strawberry-tiramisu-trifle

Procedure:
1. Set 3 strawberries for the garnish aside, and cut the rest into slices.
2. In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese with a hand whisk until creamy, gradually adding 2 tablespoons of the coffee.
3. Then stir in the custard and finally fold in the whipped cream.
4. Brush the sponge fingers with the remaining coffee.
5. Line a glass bowl with one layer of the soaked sponge fingers.
6. Spread half of the strawberries over the sponge fingers.
7. Sprinkle half of the grated chocolate over that and then half of the custard mixture.
8. Repeat the layers in order again.
9. Cut the remaining 3 strawberries in half and lay them on top of the trifle.
10. Cover and leave in the fridge for at least 4 hours, best overnight.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 6 involves spreading strawberries over the sponge fingers, which are prepared in Step 5, and Step 5 follows the preparation of the custard mixture in Step 3.

title: spanish-rabbit-stew
steps: ['After slicing all of your ingredients, throw them all into your slow cooker (everything in at once, couldn’t be easier right?', ').', 'I like to mix mine up, so I can take a big scoop and get a lovely mix of goodness.', 'Pour in half pint of white wine and half pint of water.', 'You might want to add a little more of each to cover your ingredients but the key rule is to keep the mixture 50/50.', "Make sure your tarragon and bay leaf aren’t floating on the top or it won't let off any real flavour.", 'Turn your slow cooker on to low power, let it simmer for about 5 hours.', 'If your aren’t hungry once that wonderful smell fills the room, I’ll refund the cost of the ingredients!', 'Flavour with salt and pepper to taste.', 'Cook the pasta according to the packet instructions, and serve with pasta.', 'Most importantly, enjoy!']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: spanish-rabbit-stew

Procedure:
1. After slicing all of your ingredients, throw them all into your slow cooker (everything in at once, couldn’t be easier right?
2. ).
3. I like to mix mine up, so I can take a big scoop and get a lovely mix of goodness.
4. Pour in half pint of white wine and half pint of water.
5. You might want to add a little more of each to cover your ingredients but the key rule is to keep the mixture 50/50.
6. Make sure your tarragon and bay leaf aren’t floating on the top or it won't let off any real flavour.
7. Turn your slow cooker on to low power, let it simmer for about 5 hours.
8. If your aren’t hungry once that wonderful smell fills the room, I’ll refund the cost of the ingredients!
9. Flavour with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Cook the pasta according to the packet instructions, and serve with pasta.
11. Most importantly, enjoy!

title: lamb-curry--serves-4-
steps: ['Blend the garlic, ginger and one of the onions in a food processor then mix with the curry paste.', 'Fry the lamb in a little oil, then add the remaining onion.', 'Gently fry for a minute, then add the paste and cook for a couple of minutes.', 'Add the water, tin of tomatoes, sugar, mushrooms and potatoes, and gently simmer covered for a few hours, until everything is tender.', 'Add the two fresh tomatoes and the spinach and cook for a couple of minutes, then serve.']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: lamb-curry--serves-4-

Procedure:
1. Blend the garlic, ginger and one of the onions in a food processor then mix with the curry paste.
2. Fry the lamb in a little oil, then add the remaining onion.
3. Gently fry for a minute, then add the paste and cook for a couple of minutes.
4. Add the water, tin of tomatoes, sugar, mushrooms and potatoes, and gently simmer covered for a few hours, until everything is tender.
5. Add the two fresh tomatoes and the spinach and cook for a couple of minutes, then serve.

why_answer: Step 2 involves frying the lamb and then adding the remaining onion, which is necessary before adding the paste created in Step 1 to ensure proper layering and cooking of flavors.

title: chocolate-chocolate-cake
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C / Gas Mark 4.', 'Place the chocolate chips, coffee and water in a microwave safe bowl.', 'Microwave until chocolate is almost melted.', 'Remove and whisk until mixture is smooth.', 'Set aside to cool.', 'Using a hand held mixer, beat butter and margarine together in a large bowl until creamy.', 'Gradually beat in sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each one.', 'Slowly add the flour and beat at a low speed.', 'Add the cooled chocolate to the mix and beat again.', 'In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.', 'Then increase speed and beat until stiff.', 'Fold egg white mixture, one third at a time, into the chocolate mixture until blended thoroughly.', 'Grease a 23cm springform tin or a cake tin with deep sides.', 'Wrap the bottom of the tin securely with greaseproof paper or foil, so it comes up about 1 .5cm on the sides.', 'Pour the mixture into the cake tin.', 'Bake for I hour.', 'The cake is ready when a skewer inserted about 1 .5cm from the side of the tin comes out clean.', 'Note that the cake is very dense, so the top may crack when baking.', 'Cool in the tin for 10 minutes to allow the cake to set.', 'Then remove from the tin, and allow to cool completely, which may take several hours.', 'Sift icing sugar lightly over the top for decoration.']
why_question: Why must Step 8 happen after Step 4?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: chocolate-chocolate-cake

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C / Gas Mark 4.
2. Place the chocolate chips, coffee and water in a microwave safe bowl.
3. Microwave until chocolate is almost melted.
4. Remove and whisk until mixture is smooth.
5. Set aside to cool.
6. Using a hand held mixer, beat butter and margarine together in a large bowl until creamy.
7. Gradually beat in sugar until light and fluffy.
8. Gradually beat in egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each one.
9. Slowly add the flour and beat at a low speed.
10. Add the cooled chocolate to the mix and beat again.
11. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.
12. Then increase speed and beat until stiff.
13. Fold egg white mixture, one third at a time, into the chocolate mixture until blended thoroughly.
14. Grease a 23cm springform tin or a cake tin with deep sides.
15. Wrap the bottom of the tin securely with greaseproof paper or foil, so it comes up about 1 .5cm on the sides.
16. Pour the mixture into the cake tin.
17. Bake for I hour.
18. The cake is ready when a skewer inserted about 1 .5cm from the side of the tin comes out clean.
19. Note that the cake is very dense, so the top may crack when baking.
20. Cool in the tin for 10 minutes to allow the cake to set.
21. Then remove from the tin, and allow to cool completely, which may take several hours.
22. Sift icing sugar lightly over the top for decoration.


1. Must Step 8 happen after Step 4?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 8 involves beating in egg yolks into the butter and sugar mixture, which should be prepared after the chocolate mixture from Step 4 has been set aside to cool.

title: chocolate-pancake-batter
steps: ['Sift the flour and cocoa powder into a bowl.', 'Make a well in the centre and whisk in the beaten eggs.', 'Gradually whisk in milk, melted butter and sugar.', 'For best results, set the pancake batter aside for 20 minutes to rest.', 'Heat a heavy-based non-stick frying pan (about 20-22cm in diameter) over moderate heat.', 'Use a piece of kitchen paper to grease the pan with a little sunflower oil.', 'Use a soup ladle to pour some batter into the middle of the pan, just enough to create a slightly thicker pancake than a crepe.', 'Cook for a minute or so until the pancake edges start to crisp up.', 'Use a palette knife to flip the pancake and cook the other side, about 1 minute.', 'Turn out of the pan and repeat with remaining batter, greasing the pan between pancakes if necessary.', 'Stack the pancakes on top of each other to keep warm.']
why_question: Why must Step 5 happen after Step 3?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: chocolate-pancake-batter

Procedure:
1. Sift the flour and cocoa powder into a bowl.
2. Make a well in the centre and whisk in the beaten eggs.
3. Gradually whisk in milk, melted butter and sugar.
4. For best results, set the pancake batter aside for 20 minutes to rest.
5. Heat a heavy-based non-stick frying pan (about 20-22cm in diameter) over moderate heat.
6. Use a piece of kitchen paper to grease the pan with a little sunflower oil.
7. Use a soup ladle to pour some batter into the middle of the pan, just enough to create a slightly thicker pancake than a crepe.
8. Cook for a minute or so until the pancake edges start to crisp up.
9. Use a palette knife to flip the pancake and cook the other side, about 1 minute.
10. Turn out of the pan and repeat with remaining batter, greasing the pan between pancakes if necessary.
11. Stack the pancakes on top of each other to keep warm.


1. Must Step 5 happen after Step 3?

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 5 involves heating the pan which is necessary after preparing the batter in Steps 1-4 to cook the pancakes.

title: simple-basic-cupcakes
steps: ['Preheat oven to 180 C / Gas 4.', 'Beat butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.', 'Add the eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition.', 'If the batter is too thick, stir in some milk.', 'Gradually add the flour, mixing well each time until evenly mixed.', 'Spoon tablespoons of batter into a greased muffin tin.', 'Bake in preheated oven for 15-20 minutes.', 'The cake is done when a skewer inserted to the cake comes out clean.', 'Let rest for fives minutes, then allow to cool fully on a wire rack.', 'Decorate, if desired.']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: simple-basic-cupcakes

Procedure:
1. Preheat oven to 180 C / Gas 4.
2. Beat butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition.
4. If the batter is too thick, stir in some milk.
5. Gradually add the flour, mixing well each time until evenly mixed.
6. Spoon tablespoons of batter into a greased muffin tin.
7. Bake in preheated oven for 15-20 minutes.
8. The cake is done when a skewer inserted to the cake comes out clean.
9. Let rest for fives minutes, then allow to cool fully on a wire rack.
10. Decorate, if desired.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 6 requires the oven to be preheated, which is accomplished in Step 1.

title: spiced butternut squash soup
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 190 C / Gas mark 6.', 'Pour a small layer of water in a baking dish, or a swiss roll tin.', 'Place the squash halves cut side down on the dish.', 'Bake for about 40 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the flesh.', 'Cool slightly, then remove the peel.', 'Set aside.', 'Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.', 'Add the onion, leek and garlic, and saute for a few minutes, until tender.', 'Pour the chicken stock into the pot.', 'Add the potatoes, and bring to the boil.', 'Cook for about 20 minutes, or until soft.', 'Add the squash, and mash with the potatoes until chunks are small.', 'Use an immersion hand blender to puree the soup, or transfer to a blender or food processor in batches, and puree until smooth.', 'Return to the pot.', 'Season the soup with cayenne pepper, allspice, nutmeg, ginger, salt and pepper, then stir in the sherry, cream and milk.', 'Heat through, but do not boil.', 'Ladle into bowls, and top with a dollop of soured cream if desired.']
why_question: Why must Step 7 happen after Step 6?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: spiced butternut squash soup

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 190 C / Gas mark 6.
2. Pour a small layer of water in a baking dish, or a swiss roll tin.
3. Place the squash halves cut side down on the dish.
4. Bake for about 40 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the flesh.
5. Cool slightly, then remove the peel.
6. Set aside.
7. Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.
8. Add the onion, leek and garlic, and saute for a few minutes, until tender.
9. Pour the chicken stock into the pot.
10. Add the potatoes, and bring to the boil.
11. Cook for about 20 minutes, or until soft.
12. Add the squash, and mash with the potatoes until chunks are small.
13. Use an immersion hand blender to puree the soup, or transfer to a blender or food processor in batches, and puree until smooth.
14. Return to the pot.
15. Season the soup with cayenne pepper, allspice, nutmeg, ginger, salt and pepper, then stir in the sherry, cream and milk.
16. Heat through, but do not boil.
17. Ladle into bowls, and top with a dollop of soured cream if desired.


1. Must Step 7 happen after Step 6?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 7 involves melting butter in a pot which is necessary to saute the onion, leek, and garlic before adding other ingredients, and it logically follows setting aside the cooked squash in Step 6.

title: banana-split-cake
steps: ['Preheat oven to 190 C / Gas 5.', 'In a large bowl, combine flour, 175g margarine and chopped pecans.', 'Press into the bottom of a 20x30cm tin.', 'Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.', 'Remove from oven and allow to cool.', 'In a large bowl, combine remaining margarine, eggs and icing sugar.', 'Beat with an electric mixer for 6 minutes or until fluffy.', 'Spread over cooled base.', 'Slice bananas and arrange on filling, then top with pineapple.', 'Slice strawberries and layer over bananas.', 'Cover with whipped cream.']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: banana-split-cake

Procedure:
1. Preheat oven to 190 C / Gas 5.
2. In a large bowl, combine flour, 175g margarine and chopped pecans.
3. Press into the bottom of a 20x30cm tin.
4. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.
5. Remove from oven and allow to cool.
6. In a large bowl, combine remaining margarine, eggs and icing sugar.
7. Beat with an electric mixer for 6 minutes or until fluffy.
8. Spread over cooled base.
9. Slice bananas and arrange on filling, then top with pineapple.
10. Slice strawberries and layer over bananas.
11. Cover with whipped cream.

title: tortellini-fritto-with-almond-butter
steps: ['Bring a saucepan of water to the boil.', 'Add the tortellini and cook according to the instructions on the packet, however I recommend you slightly under cook it and drain.', 'In a non-stick shallow pan, heat some olive oil and gently fry the tortellini.', "If you slightly undercooked your tortellini then it's less likely to stick to the pan.", 'Add some honey, salt to taste and around 2 tablespoons of the almond butter to the pan.', 'Continue to gently fry and stir the tortellini until golden brown.', 'Serve the tortellini with a drizzle of olive oil, freshly grated Parmesan cheese and green leaf salad of your choice.', 'Enjoy!']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: tortellini-fritto-with-almond-butter

Procedure:
1. Bring a saucepan of water to the boil.
2. Add the tortellini and cook according to the instructions on the packet, however I recommend you slightly under cook it and drain.
3. In a non-stick shallow pan, heat some olive oil and gently fry the tortellini.
4. If you slightly undercooked your tortellini then it's less likely to stick to the pan.
5. Add some honey, salt to taste and around 2 tablespoons of the almond butter to the pan.
6. Continue to gently fry and stir the tortellini until golden brown.
7. Serve the tortellini with a drizzle of olive oil, freshly grated Parmesan cheese and green leaf salad of your choice.
8. Enjoy!


1. Must Step 5 happen after Step 4?

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 5 involves adding ingredients that should be mixed with the tortellini after it has been fried as indicated in Step 4, ensuring proper cooking and flavor integration.

title: chocolate-chocolate-cake
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C / Gas Mark 4.', 'Place the chocolate chips, coffee and water in a microwave safe bowl.', 'Microwave until chocolate is almost melted.', 'Remove and whisk until mixture is smooth.', 'Set aside to cool.', 'Using a hand held mixer, beat butter and margarine together in a large bowl until creamy.', 'Gradually beat in sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each one.', 'Slowly add the flour and beat at a low speed.', 'Add the cooled chocolate to the mix and beat again.', 'In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.', 'Then increase speed and beat until stiff.', 'Fold egg white mixture, one third at a time, into the chocolate mixture until blended thoroughly.', 'Grease a 23cm springform tin or a cake tin with deep sides.', 'Wrap the bottom of the tin securely with greaseproof paper or foil, so it comes up about 1 .5cm on the sides.', 'Pour the mixture into the cake tin.', 'Bake for I hour.', 'The cake is ready when a skewer inserted about 1 .5cm from the side of the tin comes out clean.', 'Note that the cake is very dense, so the top may crack when baking.', 'Cool in the tin for 10 minutes to allow the cake to set.', 'Then remove from the tin, and allow to cool completely, which may take several hours.', 'Sift icing sugar lightly over the top for decoration.']
why_question: Why must Step 11 happen after Step 9?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: chocolate-chocolate-cake

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C / Gas Mark 4.
2. Place the chocolate chips, coffee and water in a microwave safe bowl.
3. Microwave until chocolate is almost melted.
4. Remove and whisk until mixture is smooth.
5. Set aside to cool.
6. Using a hand held mixer, beat butter and margarine together in a large bowl until creamy.
7. Gradually beat in sugar until light and fluffy.
8. Gradually beat in egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each one.
9. Slowly add the flour and beat at a low speed.
10. Add the cooled chocolate to the mix and beat again.
11. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.
12. Then increase speed and beat until stiff.
13. Fold egg white mixture, one third at a time, into the chocolate mixture until blended thoroughly.
14. Grease a 23cm springform tin or a cake tin with deep sides.
15. Wrap the bottom of the tin securely with greaseproof paper or foil, so it comes up about 1 .5cm on the sides.
16. Pour the mixture into the cake tin.
17. Bake for I hour.
18. The cake is ready when a skewer inserted about 1 .5cm from the side of the tin comes out clean.
19. Note that the cake is very dense, so the top may crack when baking.
20. Cool in the tin for 10 minutes to allow the cake to set.
21. Then remove from the tin, and allow to cool completely, which may take several hours.
22. Sift icing sugar lightly over the top for decoration.


1. Must Step 11 happen after Step 9?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 11 involves beating egg whites which are then folded into the main batter in Step 13, after the flour and chocolate mixture from Steps 9 and 10 have been prepared.

title: chicken-prawn-and-rice-soup
steps: ['Mix together the prawns, chicken, egg and cornflour.', 'Heat 750ml of the oil in wok or deep frying pan.', 'When it is hot, add prawns and chicken mixture.', 'Cook for 1/2 minute and drain.', 'Place above mixture in pot with the stock, mushrooms, water chestnuts, bamboo shoots and green beans.', 'Bring to the boil.', 'Add salt and sherry.', 'Return to the boil.', 'Reduce heat and allow to simmer.', 'Meanwhile, heat the remaining 250ml oil until it is hot.', 'Add rice and brown quickly.', 'Drain and add to soup.', 'Serve and enjoy!']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: chicken-prawn-and-rice-soup

Procedure:
1. Mix together the prawns, chicken, egg and cornflour.
2. Heat 750ml of the oil in wok or deep frying pan.
3. When it is hot, add prawns and chicken mixture.
4. Cook for 1/2 minute and drain.
5. Place above mixture in pot with the stock, mushrooms, water chestnuts, bamboo shoots and green beans.
6. Bring to the boil.
7. Add salt and sherry.
8. Return to the boil.
9. Reduce heat and allow to simmer.
10. Meanwhile, heat the remaining 250ml oil until it is hot.
11. Add rice and brown quickly.
12. Drain and add to soup.
13. Serve and enjoy!

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: spiced butternut squash soup

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 190 C / Gas mark 6.
2. Pour a small layer of water in a baking dish, or a swiss roll tin.
3. Place the squash halves cut side down on the dish.
4. Bake for about 40 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the flesh.
5. Cool slightly, then remove the peel.
6. Set aside.
7. Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.
8. Add the onion, leek and garlic, and saute for a few minutes, until tender.
9. Pour the chicken stock into the pot.
10. Add the potatoes, and bring to the boil.
11. Cook for about 20 minutes, or until soft.
12. Add the squash, and mash with the potatoes until chunks are small.
13. Use an immersion hand blender to puree the soup, or transfer to a blender or food processor in batches, and puree until smooth.
14. Return to the pot.
15. Season the soup with cayenne pepper, allspice, nutmeg, ginger, salt and pepper, then stir in the sherry, cream and milk.
16. Heat through, but do not boil.
17. Ladle into bowls, and top with a dollop of soured cream if desired.


1. Must Step 11 happen after Step 5?

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 11 involves cooking the potatoes in the soup, which requires the squash prepared in Step 5 to be ready for later addition and mashing in Step 12.

title: spiced-pumpkin-teabread
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 180尊C (350尊F, gas mark 4).', 'Line a 900 g (2 lb) loaf tin with baking parchment.', 'Steam the pumpkin flesh, or cook it in just a little boiling water, for 10 minutes or until tender.', 'Drain thoroughly, then mash with a potato masher until smooth.', 'Add the honey and sultanas, and beat well.', 'Sift the wholemeal and white flours and the allspice into a bowl, tipping in any bran left in the sieve.', 'Rub in the butter with your fingertips until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs.', 'Add the pumpkin mixture and beat well with a wooden spoon until evenly mixed.', 'Tip the mixture into the prepared tin and smooth the surface.', 'Sprinkle with the pumpkin seeds.', 'Bake for 50 minutes or until the loaf is well risen, golden brown and firm to the touch.', 'Allow the loaf to cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then turn it out onto a wire rack.', 'Gently brush with the 2 tsp honey while still warm.', 'This teabread is best served slightly warm, or within a day of making.']
why_question: Why must Step 6 happen after Step 5?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: spiced-pumpkin-teabread

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 180尊C (350尊F, gas mark 4).
2. Line a 900 g (2 lb) loaf tin with baking parchment.
3. Steam the pumpkin flesh, or cook it in just a little boiling water, for 10 minutes or until tender.
4. Drain thoroughly, then mash with a potato masher until smooth.
5. Add the honey and sultanas, and beat well.
6. Sift the wholemeal and white flours and the allspice into a bowl, tipping in any bran left in the sieve.
7. Rub in the butter with your fingertips until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs.
8. Add the pumpkin mixture and beat well with a wooden spoon until evenly mixed.
9. Tip the mixture into the prepared tin and smooth the surface.
10. Sprinkle with the pumpkin seeds.
11. Bake for 50 minutes or until the loaf is well risen, golden brown and firm to the touch.
12. Allow the loaf to cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then turn it out onto a wire rack.
13. Gently brush with the 2 tsp honey while still warm.
14. This teabread is best served slightly warm, or within a day of making.


1. Must Step 6 happen after Step 5?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 6 involves sifting flours and allspice which are then needed in Step 8 to be mixed with the pumpkin mixture created in Step 5.

title: banana-split-cake
steps: ['Preheat oven to 190 C / Gas 5.', 'In a large bowl, combine flour, 175g margarine and chopped pecans.', 'Press into the bottom of a 20x30cm tin.', 'Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.', 'Remove from oven and allow to cool.', 'In a large bowl, combine remaining margarine, eggs and icing sugar.', 'Beat with an electric mixer for 6 minutes or until fluffy.', 'Spread over cooled base.', 'Slice bananas and arrange on filling, then top with pineapple.', 'Slice strawberries and layer over bananas.', 'Cover with whipped cream.']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: banana-split-cake

Procedure:
1. Preheat oven to 190 C / Gas 5.
2. In a large bowl, combine flour, 175g margarine and chopped pecans.
3. Press into the bottom of a 20x30cm tin.
4. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.
5. Remove from oven and allow to cool.
6. In a large bowl, combine remaining margarine, eggs and icing sugar.
7. Beat with an electric mixer for 6 minutes or until fluffy.
8. Spread over cooled base.
9. Slice bananas and arrange on filling, then top with pineapple.
10. Slice strawberries and layer over bananas.
11. Cover with whipped cream.

Goal: spanish-rabbit-stew

Procedure:
1. After slicing all of your ingredients, throw them all into your slow cooker (everything in at once, couldn’t be easier right?
2. ).
3. I like to mix mine up, so I can take a big scoop and get a lovely mix of goodness.
4. Pour in half pint of white wine and half pint of water.
5. You might want to add a little more of each to cover your ingredients but the key rule is to keep the mixture 50/50.
6. Make sure your tarragon and bay leaf aren’t floating on the top or it won't let off any real flavour.

9. Flavour with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Cook the pasta according to the packet instructions, and serve with pasta.

title: cranachan
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C / Gas mark 4.', 'Spread oats out in a thin layer on a baking tray.', 'Toast in the oven for about 10 minutes, or until lightly browned.', 'Set aside to cool.', 'Remove them from the tray for faster cooling.', 'In a medium bowl, whip the cream to firm peaks.', 'Gently fold in the icing sugar, vanilla and toasted oats.', 'Spoon into 4 serving bowls, and top with fresh berries.', 'For an extra touch, drizzle some whisky over each serving.', 'Garnish with a mint leaf.']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: cranachan

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 180 C / Gas mark 4.
2. Spread oats out in a thin layer on a baking tray.
3. Toast in the oven for about 10 minutes, or until lightly browned.
4. Set aside to cool.
5. Remove them from the tray for faster cooling.
6. In a medium bowl, whip the cream to firm peaks.
7. Gently fold in the icing sugar, vanilla and toasted oats.
8. Spoon into 4 serving bowls, and top with fresh berries.
9. For an extra touch, drizzle some whisky over each serving.
10. Garnish with a mint leaf.

why_answer: Step 6 involves whipping the cream which should be done after the oats are toasted and cooled (Steps 3 and 4) to ensure they can be folded into the whipped cream without affecting its texture.

title: balsamic-and-mozzarella-chicken
steps: ['Place chicken in a shallow dish or large resealable plastic bag.', 'Pour the vinaigrette over it, cover or seal and marinate in the fridge for 12 to 24 hours.', 'Coat a large frying pan lightly with oil, and set over low heat.', 'Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the marinade.', 'Saute chicken breast fillets over low heat for about 30 minutes, or until juices run clear.', 'Arrange chicken on a serving platter.', 'Place a generous slice of fresh mozzarella on top of each piece.', 'Place a leaf of basil on top of the cheese, and cover with a slice of tomato.', 'Drizzle balsamic vinegar over the platter, then season with salt and pepper.', 'Serve!']
why_question: Why must Step 3 happen after Step 2?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: balsamic-and-mozzarella-chicken

Procedure:
1. Place chicken in a shallow dish or large resealable plastic bag.
2. Pour the vinaigrette over it, cover or seal and marinate in the fridge for 12 to 24 hours.
3. Coat a large frying pan lightly with oil, and set over low heat.
4. Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the marinade.
5. Saute chicken breast fillets over low heat for about 30 minutes, or until juices run clear.
6. Arrange chicken on a serving platter.
7. Place a generous slice of fresh mozzarella on top of each piece.
8. Place a leaf of basil on top of the cheese, and cover with a slice of tomato.
9. Drizzle balsamic vinegar over the platter, then season with salt and pepper.
10. Serve!

title: chocolate-chocolate-cake
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C / Gas Mark 4.', 'Place the chocolate chips, coffee and water in a microwave safe bowl.', 'Microwave until chocolate is almost melted.', 'Remove and whisk until mixture is smooth.', 'Set aside to cool.', 'Using a hand held mixer, beat butter and margarine together in a large bowl until creamy.', 'Gradually beat in sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each one.', 'Slowly add the flour and beat at a low speed.', 'Add the cooled chocolate to the mix and beat again.', 'In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.', 'Then increase speed and beat until stiff.', 'Fold egg white mixture, one third at a time, into the chocolate mixture until blended thoroughly.', 'Grease a 23cm springform tin or a cake tin with deep sides.', 'Wrap the bottom of the tin securely with greaseproof paper or foil, so it comes up about 1 .5cm on the sides.', 'Pour the mixture into the cake tin.', 'Bake for I hour.', 'The cake is ready when a skewer inserted about 1 .5cm from the side of the tin comes out clean.', 'Note that the cake is very dense, so the top may crack when baking.', 'Cool in the tin for 10 minutes to allow the cake to set.', 'Then remove from the tin, and allow to cool completely, which may take several hours.', 'Sift icing sugar lightly over the top for decoration.']
why_question: Why must Step 9 happen after Step 4?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: chocolate-chocolate-cake

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C / Gas Mark 4.
2. Place the chocolate chips, coffee and water in a microwave safe bowl.
3. Microwave until chocolate is almost melted.
4. Remove and whisk until mixture is smooth.
5. Set aside to cool.
6. Using a hand held mixer, beat butter and margarine together in a large bowl until creamy.
7. Gradually beat in sugar until light and fluffy.
8. Gradually beat in egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each one.
9. Slowly add the flour and beat at a low speed.
10. Add the cooled chocolate to the mix and beat again.
11. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.
12. Then increase speed and beat until stiff.
13. Fold egg white mixture, one third at a time, into the chocolate mixture until blended thoroughly.
14. Grease a 23cm springform tin or a cake tin with deep sides.
15. Wrap the bottom of the tin securely with greaseproof paper or foil, so it comes up about 1 .5cm on the sides.
16. Pour the mixture into the cake tin.
17. Bake for I hour.
18. The cake is ready when a skewer inserted about 1 .5cm from the side of the tin comes out clean.
19. Note that the cake is very dense, so the top may crack when baking.
20. Cool in the tin for 10 minutes to allow the cake to set.
21. Then remove from the tin, and allow to cool completely, which may take several hours.
22. Sift icing sugar lightly over the top for decoration.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 9 involves adding flour to the batter, which requires the chocolate mixture from Step 4 to be cooled and ready to be incorporated later in Step 10.

title: chicken and vegetable pie
steps: ['Preheat oven to 220 C / Gas mark 7.', 'In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas and celery.', 'Add water to cover and boil for 15 minutes.', 'Remove from heat, drain and set aside.', 'In the saucepan over medium heat, cook onion in butter until soft and translucent.', 'Stir in flour, salt, pepper and celery seed.', 'Slowly stir in chicken stock and milk.', 'Simmer over medium-low heat until thick.', 'Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Prepare a 23cm (9 in) pie dish by lining with pastry, reserving pastry to cover.', 'Place the chicken mixture in bottom of the prepared pie dish.', 'Pour hot liquid mixture over.', 'Cover with top pastry, seal edges, and cut away excess pastry.', 'Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly.', 'Cool for 10 minutes before serving.']
why_question: Why must Step 8 happen after Step 4?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: chicken and vegetable pie

Procedure:
1. Preheat oven to 220 C / Gas mark 7.
2. In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas and celery.
3. Add water to cover and boil for 15 minutes.
4. Remove from heat, drain and set aside.
5. In the saucepan over medium heat, cook onion in butter until soft and translucent.
6. Stir in flour, salt, pepper and celery seed.
7. Slowly stir in chicken stock and milk.
8. Simmer over medium-low heat until thick.
9. Remove from heat and set aside.
10. Prepare a 23cm (9 in) pie dish by lining with pastry, reserving pastry to cover.
11. Place the chicken mixture in bottom of the prepared pie dish.
12. Pour hot liquid mixture over.
13. Cover with top pastry, seal edges, and cut away excess pastry.
14. Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape.
15. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly.
16. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Goal: cranachan

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 180 C / Gas mark 4.
2. Spread oats out in a thin layer on a baking tray.
3. Toast in the oven for about 10 minutes, or until lightly browned.
4. Set aside to cool.
5. Remove them from the tray for faster cooling.
6. In a medium bowl, whip the cream to firm peaks.
7. Gently fold in the icing sugar, vanilla and toasted oats.
8. Spoon into 4 serving bowls, and top with fresh berries.

10. Garnish with a mint leaf.

title: spiced butternut squash soup
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 190 C / Gas mark 6.', 'Pour a small layer of water in a baking dish, or a swiss roll tin.', 'Place the squash halves cut side down on the dish.', 'Bake for about 40 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the flesh.', 'Cool slightly, then remove the peel.', 'Set aside.', 'Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.', 'Add the onion, leek and garlic, and saute for a few minutes, until tender.', 'Pour the chicken stock into the pot.', 'Add the potatoes, and bring to the boil.', 'Cook for about 20 minutes, or until soft.', 'Add the squash, and mash with the potatoes until chunks are small.', 'Use an immersion hand blender to puree the soup, or transfer to a blender or food processor in batches, and puree until smooth.', 'Return to the pot.', 'Season the soup with cayenne pepper, allspice, nutmeg, ginger, salt and pepper, then stir in the sherry, cream and milk.', 'Heat through, but do not boil.', 'Ladle into bowls, and top with a dollop of soured cream if desired.']
why_question: Why must Step 10 happen after Step 4?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: spiced butternut squash soup

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 190 C / Gas mark 6.
2. Pour a small layer of water in a baking dish, or a swiss roll tin.
3. Place the squash halves cut side down on the dish.
4. Bake for about 40 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the flesh.
5. Cool slightly, then remove the peel.
6. Set aside.
7. Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.
8. Add the onion, leek and garlic, and saute for a few minutes, until tender.
9. Pour the chicken stock into the pot.
10. Add the potatoes, and bring to the boil.
11. Cook for about 20 minutes, or until soft.
12. Add the squash, and mash with the potatoes until chunks are small.
13. Use an immersion hand blender to puree the soup, or transfer to a blender or food processor in batches, and puree until smooth.
14. Return to the pot.
15. Season the soup with cayenne pepper, allspice, nutmeg, ginger, salt and pepper, then stir in the sherry, cream and milk.
16. Heat through, but do not boil.
17. Ladle into bowls, and top with a dollop of soured cream if desired.


1. Must Step 10 happen after Step 4?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 10 involves adding potatoes to the pot which requires the squash prepared in Step 4.

title: chocolate-chocolate-cake
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C / Gas Mark 4.', 'Place the chocolate chips, coffee and water in a microwave safe bowl.', 'Microwave until chocolate is almost melted.', 'Remove and whisk until mixture is smooth.', 'Set aside to cool.', 'Using a hand held mixer, beat butter and margarine together in a large bowl until creamy.', 'Gradually beat in sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each one.', 'Slowly add the flour and beat at a low speed.', 'Add the cooled chocolate to the mix and beat again.', 'In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.', 'Then increase speed and beat until stiff.', 'Fold egg white mixture, one third at a time, into the chocolate mixture until blended thoroughly.', 'Grease a 23cm springform tin or a cake tin with deep sides.', 'Wrap the bottom of the tin securely with greaseproof paper or foil, so it comes up about 1 .5cm on the sides.', 'Pour the mixture into the cake tin.', 'Bake for I hour.', 'The cake is ready when a skewer inserted about 1 .5cm from the side of the tin comes out clean.', 'Note that the cake is very dense, so the top may crack when baking.', 'Cool in the tin for 10 minutes to allow the cake to set.', 'Then remove from the tin, and allow to cool completely, which may take several hours.', 'Sift icing sugar lightly over the top for decoration.']
why_question: Why must Step 21 happen after Step 19?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: chocolate-chocolate-cake

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C / Gas Mark 4.
2. Place the chocolate chips, coffee and water in a microwave safe bowl.
3. Microwave until chocolate is almost melted.
4. Remove and whisk until mixture is smooth.
5. Set aside to cool.
6. Using a hand held mixer, beat butter and margarine together in a large bowl until creamy.
7. Gradually beat in sugar until light and fluffy.
8. Gradually beat in egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each one.
9. Slowly add the flour and beat at a low speed.
10. Add the cooled chocolate to the mix and beat again.
11. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.
12. Then increase speed and beat until stiff.
13. Fold egg white mixture, one third at a time, into the chocolate mixture until blended thoroughly.
14. Grease a 23cm springform tin or a cake tin with deep sides.
15. Wrap the bottom of the tin securely with greaseproof paper or foil, so it comes up about 1 .5cm on the sides.
16. Pour the mixture into the cake tin.
17. Bake for I hour.
18. The cake is ready when a skewer inserted about 1 .5cm from the side of the tin comes out clean.
19. Note that the cake is very dense, so the top may crack when baking.
20. Cool in the tin for 10 minutes to allow the cake to set.
21. Then remove from the tin, and allow to cool completely, which may take several hours.
22. Sift icing sugar lightly over the top for decoration.


1. Must Step 21 happen after Step 19?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 21 involves removing the cake from the tin and allowing it to cool completely, which can only occur after the cake has finished baking and any potential cracking from baking (mentioned in Step 19) has occurred.

title: almond and apple cake
steps: ['Preheat the oven to 170 C / Gas mark 3.', 'Brush around 22cm (base measurement) cake tin with melted butter to grease.', 'Line base and side with baking parchment.', 'Beat butter, caster sugar and vanilla in a bowl for 8 mins or till pale and creamy (by hand or electric beater).', 'Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.', 'Stir in ground almonds.', 'Add half the flour and half the milk.', 'Use a wooden spoon to stir until well combined.', 'Repeat remaining flour and milk.', 'Arrange the apple, slightly overlapping, over the base of the prepared tin.', 'Spoon mixture into the tin and smooth the surface.', 'Bake in the oven for 30-35 mins or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.', 'Set aside in the pan for 10 mins to cool slightly before turning onto a serving plate.', 'Serve warm.']
why_question: Why must Step 10 happen after Step 8?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: almond and apple cake

Procedure:
1. Preheat the oven to 170 C / Gas mark 3.
2. Brush around 22cm (base measurement) cake tin with melted butter to grease.
3. Line base and side with baking parchment.
4. Beat butter, caster sugar and vanilla in a bowl for 8 mins or till pale and creamy (by hand or electric beater).
5. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.
6. Stir in ground almonds.
7. Add half the flour and half the milk.
8. Use a wooden spoon to stir until well combined.
9. Repeat remaining flour and milk.
10. Arrange the apple, slightly overlapping, over the base of the prepared tin.
11. Spoon mixture into the tin and smooth the surface.
12. Bake in the oven for 30-35 mins or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean.
13. Set aside in the pan for 10 mins to cool slightly before turning onto a serving plate.
14. Serve warm.


1. Must Step 10 happen after Step 8?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 10 involves arranging the apple slices in the prepared tin, which must be done before adding the cake mixture in Step 11, which follows the mixing process completed in Step 9.

title: tortellini-fritto-with-almond-butter
steps: ['Bring a saucepan of water to the boil.', 'Add the tortellini and cook according to the instructions on the packet, however I recommend you slightly under cook it and drain.', 'In a non-stick shallow pan, heat some olive oil and gently fry the tortellini.', "If you slightly undercooked your tortellini then it's less likely to stick to the pan.", 'Add some honey, salt to taste and around 2 tablespoons of the almond butter to the pan.', 'Continue to gently fry and stir the tortellini until golden brown.', 'Serve the tortellini with a drizzle of olive oil, freshly grated Parmesan cheese and green leaf salad of your choice.', 'Enjoy!']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: tortellini-fritto-with-almond-butter

Procedure:
1. Bring a saucepan of water to the boil.
2. Add the tortellini and cook according to the instructions on the packet, however I recommend you slightly under cook it and drain.
3. In a non-stick shallow pan, heat some olive oil and gently fry the tortellini.
4. If you slightly undercooked your tortellini then it's less likely to stick to the pan.
5. Add some honey, salt to taste and around 2 tablespoons of the almond butter to the pan.
6. Continue to gently fry and stir the tortellini until golden brown.
7. Serve the tortellini with a drizzle of olive oil, freshly grated Parmesan cheese and green leaf salad of your choice.
8. Enjoy!

Goal: chocolate-chocolate-cake

title: fusilli-and-meatballs
steps: ['Coat a large saucepan with cooking spray or a teaspoon of olive oil and set over a medium-high heat.', 'Sauté the onion and garlic for about 5 minutes or until soft.', 'Transfer 2 tablespoons of the onion mixture to a large bowl.', 'Set aside.', 'Whiz the tomatoes, with their juice, in a food processor until fairly smooth.', 'Add to the saucepan.', 'Bring to the boil over medium-high heat.', 'Reduce the heat to medium-low.', 'Cover and simmer, stirring often, for 30 minutes.', 'Add the basil and oregano halfway through this time.', 'Process the bread until crumbs form.', 'Add the crumbs, beef, egg, milk and pepper to the onion mixture in the bowl and mix just until blended.', 'Shape into 20 meatballs about 2.5cm (1in) diameter.', 'Coat a frying pan with cooking spray or olive oil and set over medium-high heat.', 'Cook the meatballs, in batches, for about 8 minutes or until browned on all sides.', 'Drain on kitchen paper.', 'Add the meatballs to the tomato sauce.', 'Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, cook the pasta according to the instructions on the packet.', 'Drain and toss with 3 ladlefuls of the sauce in a large heated serving bowl.', 'Spoon the meatballs and remaining sauce over the top, then serve.']
why_question: Why must Step 9 happen after Step 2?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: fusilli-and-meatballs

Procedure:
1. Coat a large saucepan with cooking spray or a teaspoon of olive oil and set over a medium-high heat.
2. Sauté the onion and garlic for about 5 minutes or until soft.
3. Transfer 2 tablespoons of the onion mixture to a large bowl.
4. Set aside.
5. Whiz the tomatoes, with their juice, in a food processor until fairly smooth.
6. Add to the saucepan.
7. Bring to the boil over medium-high heat.
8. Reduce the heat to medium-low.
9. Cover and simmer, stirring often, for 30 minutes.
10. Add the basil and oregano halfway through this time.
11. Process the bread until crumbs form.
12. Add the crumbs, beef, egg, milk and pepper to the onion mixture in the bowl and mix just until blended.
13. Shape into 20 meatballs about 2.5cm (1in) diameter.
14. Coat a frying pan with cooking spray or olive oil and set over medium-high heat.
15. Cook the meatballs, in batches, for about 8 minutes or until browned on all sides.
16. Drain on kitchen paper.
17. Add the meatballs to the tomato sauce.
18. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes.
19. Meanwhile, cook the pasta according to the instructions on the packet.
20. Drain and toss with 3 ladlefuls of the sauce in a large heated serving bowl.
21. Spoon the meatballs and remaining sauce over the top, then serve.


1. Must Step 9 happen after Step 2?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 9 involves simmering the tomato sauce which is added in Step 6, and the saucepan used for simmering is the same one in which the onions and garlic are sautéed in Step 2.

steps: ['Preheat oven to 190 C / Gas 5.', 'In a large bowl, combine flour, 175g margarine and chopped pecans.', 'Press into the bottom of a 20x30cm tin.', 'Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.', 'Remove from oven and allow to cool.', 'In a large bowl, combine remaining margarine, eggs and icing sugar.', 'Beat with an electric mixer for 6 minutes or until fluffy.', 'Spread over cooled base.', 'Slice bananas and arrange on filling, then top with pineapple.', 'Slice strawberries and layer over bananas.', 'Cover with whipped cream.']

Goal: banana-split-cake

Procedure:
1. Preheat oven to 190 C / Gas 5.
2. In a large bowl, combine flour, 175g margarine and chopped pecans.
3. Press into the bottom of a 20x30cm tin.
4. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.

title: curried bbq mussels
steps: ['Preheat barbecue for medium-high heat and lightly oil the cooking grate.', 'Whisk together the butter, garlic, curry powder, cumin and salt in a small bowl.', 'Arrange four large sheets of foil on a flat surface.', 'Divide the mussels into four even portions and place one portion on each piece of foil.', 'Dot the mussels with the curry mixture.', 'Sprinkle the red pepper and parsley over the top of each portion.', 'Top each with lime slices.', 'Wrap foil tightly around the portions.', 'Cook the packets on the preheated barbecue until the mussels have opened, 5 to 10 minutes.', 'Discard any mussels which do not open.', 'Transfer the mussels to small bowls and garnish each with a lime wedge to serve.']

Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: curried bbq mussels

Procedure:
1. Preheat barbecue for medium-high heat and lightly oil the cooking grate.
2. Whisk together the butter, garlic, curry powder, cumin and salt in a small bowl.
3. Arrange four large sheets of foil on a flat surface.
4. Divide the mussels into four even portions and place one portion on each piece of foil.
5. Dot the mussels with the curry mixture.
6. Sprinkle the red pepper and parsley over the top of each portion.
7. Top each with lime slices.
8. Wrap foil tightly around the portions.
9. Cook the packets on the preheated barbecue until the mussels have opened, 5 to 10 minutes.
10. Discard any mussels which do not open.
11. Transfer the mussels to small bowls and garnish each with a lime wedge to serve.

title: chicken and vegetable pie
steps: ['Preheat oven to 220 C / Gas mark 7.', 'In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas and celery.', 'Add water to cover and boil for 15 minutes.', 'Remove from heat, drain and set aside.', 'In the saucepan over medium heat, cook onion in butter until soft and translucent.', 'Stir in flour, salt, pepper and celery seed.', 'Slowly stir in chicken stock and milk.', 'Simmer over medium-low heat until thick.', 'Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Prepare a 23cm (9 in) pie dish by lining with pastry, reserving pastry to cover.', 'Place the chicken mixture in bottom of the prepared pie dish.', 'Pour hot liquid mixture over.', 'Cover with top pastry, seal edges, and cut away excess pastry.', 'Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly.', 'Cool for 10 minutes before serving.']
why_question: Why must Step 11 happen after Step 8?
model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: chicken and vegetable pie

Procedure:
1. Preheat oven to 220 C / Gas mark 7.
2. In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas and celery.
3. Add water to cover and boil for 15 minutes.
4. Remove from heat, drain and set aside.
5. In the saucepan over medium heat, cook onion in butter until soft and translucent.
6. Stir in flour, salt, pepper and celery seed.
7. Slowly stir in chicken stock and milk.
8. Simmer over medium-low heat until thick.
9. Remove from heat and set aside.
10. Prepare a 23cm (9 in) pie dish by lining with pastry, reserving pastry to cover.
11. Place the chicken mixture in bottom of the prepared pie dish.
12. Pour hot liquid mixture over.
13. Cover with top pastry, seal edges, and cut away excess pastry.
14. Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape.
15. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly.
16. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 11 involves placing the chicken mixture in the pie dish, which must be topped with the thickened liquid mixture from Step 8 to form the correct pie structure before baking.

title: cloud-bread
steps: ['Preheat oven to 150 C / Gas mark 2.', 'Line a baking tray with baking paper.', 'Mix cream cheese and egg yolks together until smooth.', 'Place egg whites and baking powder in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl;', 'beat together until stiff peaks form.', 'Fold cream cheese and egg yolk mixture gently into egg whites until just combined and light yellow in colour.', 'Spoon the batter onto the prepared baking tray in mounds about 10cm in diameter, flattening peaks with the back of the spoon.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 17 to 20 minutes.']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: cloud-bread

Procedure:
1. Preheat oven to 150 C / Gas mark 2.
2. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
3. Mix cream cheese and egg yolks together until smooth.
4. Place egg whites and baking powder in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl;
5. beat together until stiff peaks form.
6. Fold cream cheese and egg yolk mixture gently into egg whites until just combined and light yellow in colour.
7. Spoon the batter onto the prepared baking tray in mounds about 10cm in diameter, flattening peaks with the back of the spoon.
8. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 17 to 20 minutes.


1. Must Step 5 happen after Step 3?
2. Explain why or why not.

Format your answer as JSON with the key value pairs "binary_answer": "yes/no answer to Q1", "why_answer": "one sentence answer to Q2"
why_answer: Step 5 requires stiff peaks of egg whites, which should not be mixed with yolks (used in Step 3) to achieve the necessary texture for cloud bread.

title: spanish-rabbit-stew
steps: ['After slicing all of your ingredients, throw them all into your slow cooker (everything in at once, couldn’t be easier right?', ').', 'I like to mix mine up, so I can take a big scoop and get a lovely mix of goodness.', 'Pour in half pint of white wine and half pint of water.', 'You might want to add a little more of each to cover your ingredients but the key rule is to keep the mixture 50/50.', "Make sure your tarragon and bay leaf aren’t floating on the top or it won't let off any real flavour.", 'Turn your slow cooker on to low power, let it simmer for about 5 hours.', 'If your aren’t hungry once that wonderful smell fills the room, I’ll refund the cost of the ingredients!', 'Flavour with salt and pepper to taste.', 'Cook the pasta according to the packet instructions, and serve with pasta.', 'Most importantly, enjoy!']

model_input:
Given a goal, a procedure to achieve that goal and a question about the steps in the procedure, you are required to answer the questions.

Goal: spanish-rabbit-stew

Procedure:
1. After slicing all of your ingredients, throw them all into your slow cooker (everything in at once, couldn’t be easier right?
2. ).
3. I like to mix mine up, so I can take a big scoop and get a lovely mix of goodness.
4. Pour in half pint of white wine and half pint of water.
5. You might want to add a little more of each to cover your ingredients but the key rule is to keep the mixture 50/50.
6. Make sure your tarragon and bay leaf aren’t floating on the top or it won't let off any real flavour.
7. Turn your slow cooker on to low power, let it simmer for about 5 hours.
8. If your aren’t hungry once that wonderful smell fills the room, I’ll refund the cost of the ingredients!
9. Flavour with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Cook the pasta according to the packet instructions, and serve with pasta.
11. Most importantly, enjoy!
